title: The Amazing Race: Darwin duo jump out of a plane in new trailer
text:
The latest trailer for The Amazing Race shows 'Darwin Deadly Duo' Jasmin and Jerome reaching new heights in a bid to win the cash prize.

In a new sneak peak, the Indigenous couple announce they are 'here to win the race' and have all the attributes necessary to do so.

'I like doing adventurous and daredevil things,' Jerome says, before Jasmin adds rather nervously: 'I'm not exactly a huge fan of heights!'

Here goes! The latest trailer for The Amazing Race shows 'Darwin Deadly Duo' Jasmin and Jerome reaching new heights in a bid to win the cash prize

The trailer then cuts to a clearly frightened Jasmin strapped to her partner and parachute gear in the back of a light aeroplane.

'Oh my god,' she says. 'I would never want to jump out of a perfectly working plane - worst nightmare!'

It remains to be seen whether Jasmin is able overcome her fear, but fans won't have long to wait as The Amazing Race premieres later this month.

Ambitious: In a new sneak peak, the Indigenous couple announce they are 'here to win the race' and have all the attributes necessary to do so

According to 10 Daily, Jasmin is extremely organised and very well planned.

But Jerome suggested that 'the eating challenges might be a weakness' for the couple.

Jasmin added: 'Jerome and I have achieved a lot in our respective 30 years and we want to challenge the sometimes negative portrayal of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.'

Will her fear of heights cost them the competition? The trailer then cuts to a clearly frightened Jasmin strapped to her partner and parachute gear in the back of a light aeroplane

The new season of The Amazing Race Australia will be hosted by Beau Ryan.

The reality show features 11 teams racing across three continents in a bid to win $250,000 in prize money.

The Amazing Race Australia premieres October 28 at 7.30pm on Channel 10
description: The latest trailer for The Amazing Race shows 'Darwin Deadly Duo' Jasmin and Jerome reaching new heights in a bid to win the cash prize.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
